comments.body:
from the docs "See the list of all available props for `<PhoneInput/>`. All properties not listed there will be passed through to the phone number <input/> component." 

The props for this should also take any valid `<input/>` props.

```typescript
export interface PhoneInputProps extends Omit<React.InputHTMLAttributes<HTMLInputElement>, "onChange" | "id"> {
```

Thanks.
Have created a PR for that: https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped/pull/41898

From what I understand [labels](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/HTMLSelectElement/labels) is a read-only prop from a `<select/>` element. Is not a prop that can be passed!! 
Also, I looked in the [react-phone-number-input](https://gitlab.com/catamphetamine/react-phone-number-input) and did not see any usage in the `countrySelectComponent`.
What am I missing?

In according to the documentation it is possible to pass a `labels` prop when you create a custom country `<select/>` https://gitlab.com/catamphetamine/react-phone-number-input/-/blob/master/README.md#L187. 

And after, this custom component can be used as a `countrySelectComponent` prop.

I am not sure that in this example component is the same as [countrySelectComponent](https://gitlab.com/catamphetamine/react-phone-number-input/-/tree/master#countryselectcomponent) passed to `<PhoneInput/>`.

I don't use this package right now and don't sure if the `labels` prop is needed?
Did you have such a use case and typing was missing?
Maybe another interface should be used in this case?
Good, I would suggest also adding `labels` prop in `types/react-phone-number-input/react-phone-number-input-tests.tsx` as you did with `getCountries`.
